sections.heading: Hours of labor in cotton or woolen manufacturing establishmentsSection 34-3-2 - Effect of contracts requiring more than 40 hours of work per weekSection 34-3-3 - Actions for violations of chapter; disposition of amount recoveredSection 34-3-4 - Penalties for violations of chapter
sections.text:
The hours of labor required of all persons employed in all cotton or woolen manufacturing establishments in this state, except engineers, firefighters, watchmen, mechanics, teamsters, yard employees, clerical force, and all help that may be needed to clean up and make necessary repairs or changes in or of machinery, shall not exceed ten hours per day; or the same may be regulated by employers, so that the number of hours shall not in the aggregate exceed 60 hours per week, provided that nothing contained in this Code section shall be construed to prevent any of the aforesaid employees from working such time as may be necessary to make up lost time, not to exceed ten days, caused by accidents or other unavoidable circumstances.Amended by 2002 Ga. Laws 787, § 4, eff. 7/1/2002.Amended by 2002 Ga. Laws 952, § 11, eff. 7/1/2002.

sections.heading: Effect of contracts requiring more than 40 hours of work per week
sections.text:
All contracts which require employees of cotton or woolen manufacturing establishments to work more than 40 hours per week shall be null and void.

sections.heading: Actions for violations of chapter; disposition of amount recovered
sections.text:
Any person with whom a contract violative of this chapter is made or any person having knowledge thereof may institute an action against such cotton or woolen manufacturing establishment; and the amount recovered as a fine shall inure to the benefit of the board of education of the county in which the violation shall have occurred.
